gurmukhi: duMdB GoKn Awid kih irp Air AMq aucwr ] nwm qupk ky hoq hYN cIn cqur inrDwr ]561]
transliteration: Doundabh Ghokhan Aadh Kah(i) Rip Ar(i) Ant Ouchaar|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Cheen Chatur Nirdhaar||561||
translation: Saying firstly the word “Dundubhi-dhanani” and then adding “Ripu Ari” at the end, the names of Tupak are formed.561.

gurmukhi: nwd insnI Awid kih irp Air bhur bKwn ] nwm qupk ky hoq hYN krIAhu cqur pRmwn ]562]
transliteration: Naad Nisaniaadh Kah(i) Rip Ar(i) Bahur Bakhaan|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Dareeauh Chatur Pramaan||562||
translation: Saying firstly the word “Naad-Nisani” and then adding “Ripu Ari”, the names of Tupak are formed.562.

gurmukhi: AinknI pd Awid kih irp pd bhur bKwn ] nwm qupk ky hoq hYN lIjhu smJ sujwn ]563]
transliteration: Aneekanipad Aadh Kah(i) Rip Pad Bahur Pakhaan|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Leejoh Samajh Sujaan||563||
translation: Saying firstly the word “Anikni” and then adding the word “Ripu Ari”, O wise men ! the names of Tupak are formed.563.

gurmukhi: piRQm FwlnI Sbd kih irp Air AMq aucwr ] nwm qupk ky hoq hYN lIjhu smJ ibcwr ]564]
transliteration: Pritham Dhaalanishabad Kah(i) Rip Ar(i) Ant Ouchaar|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Leejoh Samajh Bichaar||564||
translation: Saying firstly the word “Dhaalani” and then uttering “Ripu Ari” at the end, the names of Tupak are formed, which may be comprehended thoughtfully.564.

gurmukhi: FFnI Awid aucwir kY irp pd bhuro dyhu ] nwm qupk ky hoq hYN cIn cqur icq lyhu ]565]
transliteration: Dhanhaniaadh Oucdaar(i) Kai Rip Pad Bahuro Deh(u)|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Cheen Chatur Chit Leh(u)||565||
translation: Add the word “Ripu” after saying the word “Dhadhni” primarily, and in this way recognize the names of Tupak.565.

gurmukhi: sMKinsonI Awid kih irp Air bhur aucwr ] nwm qupk ky hoq hYN cIn cqur inrDwr ]566]
transliteration: Sankh-nisoniaadh Kah(i) Rip Ar(i) Bahur Ouchaar|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Cheen Chatur Nirdhaar||566||
translation: Saying firstly the word “Shankhnishoni” and then uttering “Ripu Ari”, the names of Tupak are formed.566.

gurmukhi: sMK SbdnI Awid kih irp Air AMq aucwr ] nwm qupk ky hoq hYN lIjhu cqur suDwr ]568]
transliteration: Sankh Shabdaniaadh Kah(i) Rip Ar(i) Ant Bakhaan|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Leejoh Chatur Sudhaar||567||
translation: Saying the word “Shankh-Shabadni” primarily and then uttering “Ripu Ari”, at the end, the names of Tupak are formed.567.

gurmukhi: sMKnwdnI Awid kih irp Air AMq aucwr ] nwm qupk ky hoq hYN lIjhu smJ sujwn ]568]
transliteration: Sankh-naadaniaadh Kah(i) Rip Ar(i) Ant Ouchaar|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Leejoh Samajh Sujaan||568||
translation: Saying the word “Shankh-naadni” in the beginning and then adding “Ripu Ari” at the end, the names of Tupak are formed, which O wise men ! you may comprehend.568.

gurmukhi: isMGnwdnI Awid kih irp Air AMq aucwr ] nwm qupk ky hoq hYN lIjhu su kib suDwr ]569]
transliteration: Singh-naadaniaadh Kah(i) Rip Ar(i) Ant Ouchaar|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Leejoh Su Kabi Sudhaar||569||
translation: Saying the word “Singh-naadani’ in the beginning and then adding “Ripu Ari” at the end, O good poet ! the names of Tupak are formed correctly.569.

gurmukhi: plBCnwdin Awid kih irp Air AMq bKwn ] nwm qupk ky hoq hYN cqur ic`q pihcwn ]570]
transliteration: Palbhachh-naadan(i) Aadh Kah(i) Rip Ar(i) Ant Bakhaan|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Chatur Chitt Paihchaan||570||
translation: Saying the word “Palbhaksh-naadani” in the beginning and then adding “Ripu Ari” at the end, the names of Tupak are formed.570.

gurmukhi: ibAwGR nwdnI Awid kih irp Air bhur bKwn ] nwm qupk ky hoq hYN lIjhu smJ sujwn ]571]
transliteration: Biaaghra Naadaniaadh Kah(i) Rip Ar(i) Ant Bakhaan|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Leejoh Samajh Sujaan||571||
translation: Saying firstly “Vyaghra-Naadni” and then “Ripu Ari” , the names of Tupak are formed.571.

gurmukhi: hrj`Cnwdin aucir kY irp Air AMq bKwn ] nwm qupk ky hoq hYN lIjhu cqur pCwn ]572]
transliteration: Harjachchh- Naadan(i) Ouchar(i) Kai Rip Ar(i) Ant Bakhaan|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Leejoh Chatur Pachhaad||572||
translation: Saying the word “Haryaksh-naadini” in the beginning and then adding “Ripu Ari” at the end, the names of Tupak are formed.572.

gurmukhi: puMfrIknwdin aucir kY irp pd AMq bKwn ] nwm qupk ky hoq hYN cIn lyhu buiDvwn ]573]
transliteration: Poundreek-naadan(i) Ouchar(i) Kai Rip Pad Ant Bakhaan|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Cheen Lehu Budh(u)vaan||573||
translation: Saying firstly the word “Pundreek-naadini” and adding the word “Ripu Ari” at the end, the names of Tupak are formed, which O wise men ! you may comprehend.573.

gurmukhi: hrnwidn pd piRQm kih irp Air AMq aucwr ] nwm qupk ky hoq hYN lIjhu cqur ibcwr ]574]
transliteration: Harnaadin Pad Pritham Kah(i) Rip Ar(i) Ant Ouchaar|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Leejh Chatur Bichaar||574||
translation: Saying the word “Harnaadini” in the beginning and then adding “Ripu Ari” at the end, the names of Tupak are formed.574.
